content.description: Climb 15m of a 4th Class approach through a hand crack in a progressively steepening, right-facing dihedral.
content.protection: Gear to 2". There is no fixed anchor. Slung boulders 10m west of the topout offer a 30m rappel to the base.
content.location: This ascends a southeast-facing dihedral on the south face of the crag.

content.description:
There isn't room in the graduate student stipend for a bolting setup, but there is some potential at the crag to reward those that bring a drill.

Climb over flakes to a fingercrack. Break left at the left-leaning handcrack, and jog back right to the topout.
content.protection: A standard rack. Walk off to the west.
content.location: It is on the east-facing wall at the top of the 4th Class slab approach.

climbs.name: The Good, the Bad, & the Left”ßver Crack

content.description: This is a short and stout hand to rattly fist crack.
content.protection: Gear 1"-4". There is no fixed anchor. Walk off to the west.
content.location:
It is the handcrack on a south-southeast-facing wall visible from the approach. Ascend 4th Class slabs on the south face, and move left on a large ledge past the east-facing wall with '

No Budget for a Bosch

'. Turn the corner, and look for the crack splitting the orange, south-facing wall just left of the arete.
